thread.title: East Mississippi disqualified from JC football playoffs
thread.title_full: East Mississippi disqualified from JC football playoffs

title: East Mississippi disqualified from JC football playoffs
text:
East Mississippi disqualified from JC football playoffs Courtney Cronin, The Clarion-Ledger 3:20 p.m. CDT October 23, 2015 Captured from a video of the bench-clearing fight during Thursday night's East Mississippi-Mississippi Delta football game. (Photo: FACEBOOK) 291 CONNECT 18 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
East Mississippi Community College has been disqualified from 2015 MACJC football playoffs because of the events stemming from Thursday's bench-clearing brawl with Mississippi Delta, according to a statement Friday from the MACJC. 
Northwest is now the No. 1 seed in the North and Itawamba CC is the No. 2 seed for the North in the playoffs. 
From the statement by MACJC commissioner Jim Southward: 
Based upon the altercation last night between East Mississippi CC and Mississippi Delta CC, East Mississippi CC will not be eligible to participate in the MACJC football playoffs. Both schools will have to adhere to the NJCAA ejection policy which states "mandatory ejection and removal from the venue for any bench personnel other than the head coach who leaves the bench or designated warm up area when a fight may break out or has broken out. A two-contest suspension to be served during the next two regularly scheduled or postseason contests. Suspension of a coach or player at the end of a season of play shall carry over to the next season." 
The playoff format will now be the following: 
No. 1 North (Northwest) will host No. 2 South (East Central) 
No. 2 South (Gulf Coast) will host No. 2 North (Itawamba) 
More to follow 291 CONNECT 18 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://on.thec-l.com/1S1emK6 TOP VIDEOS
